metadata.title: CVE-2018-10323 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The xfs_bmap_extents_to_btree function in fs/xfs/libxfs/xfs_bmap.c in theLinux kernel through 4.16.3 allows local users to cause a denial of service(xfs_bmapi_write NULL pointer dereference) via a crafted xfs image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10323` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-157-generic - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-lowlatency - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-157-generic - 3.13.0-157.207
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-189-generic - 4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-189-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-189-lowlatency - 4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-189-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-189-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-189-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-189-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-189-generic - 4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-189-lowlatency - 4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1077-aws - 4.4.0-1077.81
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-157.207').
